edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.FinalProject

Class Jedi

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.FinalProject.Person
      • edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.FinalProject.Jedi
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public class Jedi
extends Person
    The Jedi object represents the enemy in the game. They will first stab in each direction, trying to kill the player, and if they fail they will move one space in a random direction. If they succeed in stabbing the player, then the Person.die() method will be called. If the Jedi dies, then all its fields will be set to null and the Jedi will cease being in the game.
    Author:
    Team Jedi
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Fields

      private boolean chasing
      The value that determines whether the jedi is chasing Player

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Jedi(int x, int y, boolean c)
      The Jedi constructor will set the Jedi's Person.location to a random spot on the Map, as long as that location isn't already taken by another Person, or if the spot is within 2 spaces of the Player's original location.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void die(Map m, boolean b)
      The die method will set all the Jedi's fields to null, so that the Jedi will be out of the game.
      boolean getChasing()
      Returns the value of chasing
      void move(int d, Map m)
      The move method will generate a random number 1 <= x <=4 and move the Jedi 1 space in that direction (1 up, 2 right, 3 down, 4 left).
      void setChasing(boolean c)
      Changes whetere the Jedi is chasing or not
      boolean stab(Player p, Map m, boolean b, boolean GUI)
      The stab method will check each space next to the Jedi to see if the player is inside, and if he or she is, it will call the Person.die() method.

    • Method Detail

      • die

        public void die(Map m,
       boolean b)
        The die method will set all the Jedi's fields to null, so that the Jedi will be out of the game.
        Overrides:
        die in class Person
        Parameters:
        m - The map needed so that we can get the areas.
        b - The isDebug boolean

      • move

        public void move(int d,
        Map m)
        The move method will generate a random number 1 <= x <=4 and move the Jedi 1 space in that direction (1 up, 2 right, 3 down, 4 left).

      • stab

        public boolean stab(Player p,
           Map m,
           boolean b,
           boolean GUI)
        The stab method will check each space next to the Jedi to see if the player is inside, and if he or she is, it will call the Person.die() method. If the player is successfully stabbed, it will return a true, but if not, it will return a false.
        Returns:
        true if the player was stabbed, false if the player was not stabbed.
